title: India can become the AI application use case capital of the world: MeitY official
content: ‘Software Technology Parks of India, which has been driving the software growth story of India, should be able to kick start the AI revolution in India’

title: Stalemate over third round of counselling of MBB, BDS courses continues as Karnataka High Court delivers divergent verdict on KEA’s procedure
content: The petitions, filed by some of the candidates challenging the procedure of allotment in the third round, will be heard by a third judge and till then the counselling process for 900 seats will be on hold

title: Government to train women who’ve taken career breaks in semiconductor industry
content: This training programme is mostly designed for women who have taken a career break and still want to get back to work after a sabbatical of some years

title: U.P. ATS seeks details on madrassas; opposition alleges fear mongering
content: The inquiry has been criticised by opposition parties who allege attempts are being made to politicise security and portray every Muslim as a suspect

title: L&T to produce armoured vehicle BvS10 Sindhu for Indian Army at Hazira facility
content: The contract also includes a comprehensive integrated logistics support package for initial deployment, maintenance, and life-cycle sustainment, L&T said in a filing to BSE

title: Taliban’s trade Minister in Delhi amidst Afghanistan-Pakistan clashes to enhance sea connectivity
content: Alhaj Nooruddin Azizi has come with a large business delegation to strengthen bilateral trade and investment; India is keen on importing Afghan agriculture produce and minerals

title: Karnataka govt. notifies 369 wards delimitation for five Bengaluru corporations
content: The final notification revises the draft proposal, which suggested 368 wards, and raises the number to 369 by adding one more ward to the Bengaluru West City Corporation

title: Days after delivering death sentence for former PM Hasina, Bangladesh invites NSA Doval to visit Dhaka
content: Doval will host his counterparts from Maldives, Mauritius, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh at the Colombo Security Conclave, the Ministry of External Affairs said in an announcement

title: The forgotten 316 families in Kochi: victims of development speak out
content: The acquisition of land for ICTT connectivity displaced 316 families across seven villages spanning three Assembly constituencies and six local bodies in Ernakulam

title: ED attaches assets worth ₹11.26 crore in cyber fraud case
content: It was alleged that syndicate members targeted foreign nationals by posing as law enforcement officials and extorted huge amounts from them on the threat of arresting them or freezing their bank accounts

title: Crime Branch nabs U.P. native in medical seat fraud after five years on the run
content: The accused operated mainly from Delhi and Noida, and placed large-scale advertisements on online and social media platforms promising medical admissions in reputed institutions across Indi

title: SC declines quota for promotee judges in Higher Judicial Service
content: SC says there is no disproportionate representation of direct recruits in the higher judiciary that hurts promotees; cannot create artificial classification of members within a cadre, it says

title: Hyderabad launches ‘Senior Saathi’ to foster companionship between youth and elderly
content: Programme designed against backdrop of rapid social change, where shifting family structures and migration have left many elderly persons with fewer opportunities for regular social interaction

title: ED facilitates release of assets to victims in Rotomac Global case
content: The ED probe is based on a FIR registered by the Central Bureau of Investigation, alleging that the company cheated the Bank of Baroda to the tune of ₹456.38 crore

title: Dr. NTR Health University in A.P. to release provisional lists for admission
content: Health Minister asks the university to release such a list after complaints over the final list for admission; university blames technical glitch for the confusion

title: Withdraw draft seeds Bill, urges Samyukt Kisan Morcha
content: SKM leaders say the draft seed Bill surrendered the seed sovereignty of India and it is aimed at predatory pricing by  corporate monopolies

title: BJP to prepare blueprint for development of capital in six months if voted to power, says  Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: He says poor waste collection and clogged drainages are among the main achievements of the ruling LDF and calls Congress the e ‘B’ team of CPI(M)

title: Presidential Reference: Supreme Court verdict on November 20 on fixing timeline for President, Governors to clear bills
content: The President’s decision for Presidential Reference had come after the April 8 verdict of the apex court, on powers of the governor in dealing with bills passed by the Tamil Nadu government

title: CPI(M) to launch Bangla Bachao Yatra in West Bengal ahead of 2026 Assembly polls
content: The Bangla Bachao Yatra is likely to traverse across West Bengal from north to south.  The yatra will start at Tufanganj in Cooch Behar on November 29 and will conclude at Kamarhati in North 24 Parganas on December 17

title: Fact-finding team alleges brutal assault of prisoners in Viyyur High-Security Prison
content: It demands judicial inquiry into human rights violations inside Viyyur jail as well as other prisons in the State

title: Medina bus crash: Paperwork ahead of burial requires NOC from kin and DNA testing, says Telangana official
content: Bodies of the victims are currently placed in three different hospitals in Saudi Arabia, says Secretary for Minorities Welfare B. Shafiullah

title: Burials of Medina bus crash victims from Hyderabad likely on Friday: Azharuddin
content: The Telangana Minorities Welfare Minister says the government has sought burials at the revered Jannat-ul-Baqi for Hyderabad victims of the devastating bus-tanker collision in Medina that killed 45 Indian pilgrims

title: BJP, JD(S) leaders extend support as agitation enters 20th day in Koppal
content: BJP MLC Hemalatha Naik has said that she will raise the issue of Baldota iron ore mine expansion once again during the Winter Session

title: MGNREGA employment declines for second year in a row
content: Lib Tech tracker shows 11.7% fall in persondays in FY 2025-26; States such as Uttarakhand and Telangana see steep drops

title: Corpus fund of ₹1 crore will be set up in KSPCB : Siddaramaiah
content: An award will be instituted in the name of environmentalist Saalumarada Thimmakka who passed away recently

title: Press bodies decry data protection law’s lack of exemptions for journalists
content: The Editors Guild of India and Digipub reiterate earlier objections to the law; the IT Ministry says an FAQ document addressing these concerns will be put out soon

title: Over 49 lakh Gujarat farmers to receive ₹986 crore under PM-KISAN
content: Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel and Agriculture Minister Jitu Vaghani distributed approval letters for agricultural assistance schemes worth over ₹11.68 lakh

title: Ex-Deputy Collector joins the poll fray in Kozhikode
content: E. Antihakumari, who retired from service in May 2025, is contesting the local body election as LDF candidate from the Mathottam ward of the Kozhikode Corporation

title: India extends Buddha relics exposition in Bhutan
content: The 16-day Global Peace Prayer Festival concludes in Thimphu with the full ordination of 270 nuns toward gender parity in the Vajrayana monastic tradition

title: CAG issues advisory to standardise govt. expenditure classification across India
content: A memorandum said the advisory for a uniform object head structure was made based on the recommendations of a Working Group and engagement with the Union Finance Ministry

title: HC cancels default bail given to three accused in liquor scam case
content: Dhanunjaya Reddy, Krishna Mohan Reddy, and Balaji Govindappa have been directed to approach the ACB Court for regular bail and surrender before it by November 26

title: Rift in BJP comes to the fore in Palakkad municipality
content: A memorandum signed by 117 BJP supporters has appealed to the RSS to reconsider the decision to field BJP State treasurer E. Krishnadas in Pattikkara. They say prefer a candidate from the ward

title: Govt. authorises CID to attach ₹68-crore worth properties of former YSRCP MLA Chevireddi Bhaskar Reddy in liquor scam case
content: Action follows a detailed report submitted by the Director-General of Police on the findings of the SIT that point to large-scale irregularities in the State’s excise policy during the previous regime

title: Madras High Court injuncts use of Vinnaithaandi Varuvaayaa scenes, songs in Aaromaley movie
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar grants the interim injunction pursuant to a copyright infringement suit filed by the producer of VTV

title: Telangana kicks off World Heritage Week with Hyderabad Old City walk
content: Week-long initiative planned to highlight and celebrate State’s tangible and intangible heritage through curated walks, cultural performances, competitions and a stakeholder round-table

title: 4-year-old run over and killed by school bus in Idukki, another child injured
content: Accident occurs on the premises of Giri Jyothi CMI Public School in Idukki. Police seize vehicle, take driver into custody

title: Kerala HC pulls up TDB for poor crowd management at Sabarimala
content: Court asks why preparations for the Mandalam-Makaravilakku season did not begin at least six months in advance and directs TDB to put in place scientific crowd management measures

title: Robotic technology to curb illegal water connections
content: The robotic technology enables quick detection of leakage sources without excessive road digging, says Deputy Chief Minister Shivakumar

title: National Mission on Tuber Crops proposed for popularising tuber crops
content: Proposal presented at the 20th International Symposium of the International Society for Tropical Root Crops under way in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Muslim body seeks separate government nodal agency for Haj and Umrah pilgrims
content: Highlights need for a dedicated department at the Centre through the Ministry of External Affairs and the Ministry of Minority Welfare, similar to the model followed by the State of Kerala

title: Zubeen was plied with alcohol by those with designs on his wealth: Assam CM
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma also said migrant Muslims were misusing the name of the Assamese cultural icon to save themselves from eviction

title: ‘Operation Sambhav’ foils Maoists’ bid to revive movement in Andhra Pradesh
content: The outlawed CPI (Maoist) has lost 16 of its key leaders since the launch of the operation six months ago, says ASR district Superintendent of Police Amit Bardar

title: Why we're about to find out if Al Davis was right about Lane Kiffin
content: In different circumstances, Kiffin could -- maybe even should -- leave Ole Miss. But not these circumstances.

title: Browns say QB Sanders to make first NFL start
content: Shedeur Sanders will start at quarterback for the Browns against the Raiders, coach Kevin Stefanski said.

title: Falcons' Penix to have season-ending ACL surgery
content: Atlanta Falcons starting quarterback Michael Penix Jr. has a partially torn ACL in his left knee and will undergo season-ending surgery, the team announced Wednesday.

title: Raiola's brother Dayton decommits from Huskers
content: Dayton Raiola, a three-star passer in the 2026 class and the younger brother of Nebraska quarterback Dylan Raiola, announced his decommitment from the Huskers, reopening his recruitment weeks before the early signing period.

title: Source: No further discipline for Stars' Rantanen
content: The NHL Department of Player Safety has decided Stars forward Mikko Rantanen will not receive any supplemental discipline for his boarding major against the Islanders, a source told ESPN.

title: Top 3 of CFP unchanged; Tide drop, UGA to No. 4
content: Ohio State, Indiana and Texas A&M remained the top three teams in the latest College Football Playoff rankings, while Alabama dropped six spots to No. 10 and was replaced by Georgia at No. 4.

title: Lakers score 140 in LeBron's historic season debut
content: Lakers star LeBron James made his season debut against the Jazz, taking the court to begin an NBA-record 23rd season.

content: Here's what led to the end of Nico Harrison's tenure with the Dallas Mavericks 11 games into the season, and how Mark Cuban was involved.

content: Two weeks before the season, the Rookie of the Year nominee didn't even know whether she'd make a team.

content: There are still 64 national teams that can win the FIFA World Cup next summer. Let's go through them all and rank where they stand.

content: Matthew Stafford is now the favorite to win MVP, but can he hold off Drake Maye, Josh Allen, Patrick Mahomes and Taylor?

content: Why to feel good about starting Brock Purdy and Quinshon Judkins, but be worried about Justin Jefferson.

content: The most and least favorable matchups for this week's games at four key fantasy positions: QB, RB, WR and TE.

content: Early injuries scattering the No. 1 pick race? Only two guards in the top 10? Let's project all 30 picks for the 2026 first round.

content: Just over a year ago, the U.S. was eliminated by Uruguay in the 2024 Copa America. Now things are very different.

content: Devin Haney is only 26, a pound-for-pound talent and unbeaten. So why is he facing a crossroads fight against Brian Norman Jr.?

content: Bad Bunny's Super Bowl set is drawing early buzz, but search data shows which halftime shows have truly stood the test of time.

content: The uniform draws inspiration from the ship, which was one of the six original frigates of the U.S. Navy.

title: "Sorry Mummy...": Delhi Boy Jumps To Death From Metro Station, Blames Teachers
content: A Class 10 student in one of Delhi's leading schools has died by suicide by jumping from a Metro station and left behind a suicide note in which he has blamed his teachers.

title: Opinion: Opinion: How Hasina's Death Sentence Has Put Delhi-Dhaka Relations At Crossroads
content: The Bangladesh International Crimes Tribunal sentenced ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to death for crimes against humanity, which also included directing destructive force during the June 2024 student-led protests.

title: In Shashi Tharoor's Post For Indira Gandhi, A "For Good And Ill" Reminder
content: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday honoured the "towering legacy" of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi on her birth anniversary and said "today, one remembers a figure who left a major imprint, for good and ill."

title: "Drunk" Villagers Attack Voter Roll Clean-Up Team In Madhya Pradesh
content: A government team conducting the special intensive revision (SIR) of electoral rolls came under attack on Wednesday when a group of drunk villagers allegedly threw stones at them.

title: 'Don't Mind Criticism Of Judiciary, But Should Be In Proper Way': Top Court
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said it does not mind criticism of the judiciary, but there should not be sweeping allegations of any kind.

title: Watch: Robot Dances For Putin Days After Another Russian Robot Stumbled
content: An AI-powered robot danced for President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday at an exhibition put on by Sberbank, Russia's largest bank, designed to showcase the company's technological advances.

title: MK Stalin Slams Centre Over Metro Rejection for Madurai, Coimbatore, BJP Counters
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday sharply criticised the Union government for rejecting metro rail projects for Madurai and Coimbatore, calling the decision "cheap" and "a vendetta" against the state for rejecting the BJP.

title: Rajasthan School Boy Dies By Suicide After Alleged Harassment By Teachers
content: A 14-year-old Class 9 student has ended his life after he was allegedly harassed by two teachers and the school administrator in a village in Rajasthan's Karauli district, police said on Wednesday.

title: 1 Dead, 16 Injured After Bus Collision In UP's Hardoi
content: A man was killed and 16 others were injured after a private bus veered off the Lucknow Highway and entered a field after being hit head-on by an unidentified vehicle coming from the opposite direction on Wednesday afternoon, officials said.

title: Fight Breaks Out At Haryana Wedding After Dancer Slaps Guest On Stage
content: A fight broke out at a wedding function in Haryana's Nuh after a woman performer allegedly slapped a guest on stage when he attempted to misbehave with her, leading to chaos and fisticuffs that were somehow managed by the villagers.

title: NOTA vs Netas: How Voter Discontent Shaped Bihar's Tightest Battles
content: Bihar has completed its assembly elections, and the NDA has secured a sweeping victory with 202 seats. The BJP has emerged as the standout performer this time. But beyond the big wins, another trend quietly made its mark-the rise of NOTA.

title: Tesla's First India Centre To Open In Gurugram This Month
content: Electric car-maker Tesla is set to bolster its India presence with the opening of its first full-fledged centre in Gurugram this month, marking a key milestone in its bid to expand volumes and retail visibility.

title: Newborn Dies After Delivery In Karnataka Hospital Corridor
content: In a tragic incident, a newborn died at the state-run Haveri Women and Children's hospital in Karnataka, allegedly due to the negligence of hospital staff, police said on Wednesday.

title: "Absolutely Not A Setback": PMK President Anbumani Ramadoss On Internal Rift
content: PMK President Anbumani Ramadoss has dismissed concerns that the party's internal conflict will weaken its chances in the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly election.

title: Robbers In Bengaluru Pose As Tax Officers, Loot Crores From Cash Van
content: In a major daylight robbery in Bengaluru, a group of armed men posing as Central Tax officers interepreted an ATM cash-loading vehicle near the Ashoka Pillar and looted worth crores of rupees.

title: 'Contribution Of Immigrants Phenomenal': Sundar Pichai On H-1B Visa Crackdown
content: Sundar Pichai has praised the role of immigrants in shaping the US' technology landscape, calling their contributions "phenomenal". He said that the government "understands it" and that there are still avenues to bring "talented individuals".

title: Supreme Court Strikes Down Key Provisions Of Tribunal Reforms Law
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday directed the Centre to constitute a national tribunals commission within four months as it struck down key provisions of the 2021 Tribunals Reforms law related to appointment, tenure and service conditions of tribunal m

title: PM Inaugurates Tamil Nadu Farmers Summit, Holds Roadshow Months Ahead Of Polls
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today inaugurated the Natural Farmers Summit in Coimbatore, a mega gathering that would bring together nearly 50,000 farmers from across South India to promote natural and indigenous farming practices.

title: Nitish Cabinet Formation: 5 Key Factors That Will Shape The New Team
content: With the NDA's resounding victory in Bihar, all eyes are now on Nitish Kumar's new cabinet. The veteran leader will take oath as Chief Minister for the tenth time on 20th November, and the state can have up to 36 ministers besides the Chief Minister.

title: Video: Volcano Erupts In Indonesia, Spews Ash 13km Into Sky
content: A volcano on Indonesia's main island of Java erupted on Wednesday, throwing ash and gas kilometres into the sky and forcing officials to raise the alert status to its highest level.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: F-35s, AI chips, and trillions: How MBS, once a ‘pariah’, took back Washington
content: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, once a pariah, has made a remarkable comeback in Washington, securing significant US investment and military hardware.  His visit, marked by military fanfare and high-profile meetings, underscores Saudi Arabia's renewed strategic importance to the US, despite lingering human rights concerns. MBS skillfully leveraged geopolitical competition to his advantage.

title: Unjustified! Why Trump should now withdraw 25% Russian oil tariffs on India - explained
content: GTRI has urged the Trump administration to immediately lift the 25% tariff on Indian crude oil imports from Russia. Citing India's substantial reduction in Russian oil purchases and increased energy trade with the US, the GTRI argues the original rationale for the surcharge no longer applies.

title: New Bihar govt: Nitish to take oath as CM for 10th time; what will his cabinet look like?
content: Patna gears up for a significant political event as Nitish Kumar is set to be sworn in as chief minister for a record tenth time. Following his resignation, the NDA alliance has elected him leader, and he will stake his claim to form the new government.

title: Pakistan Asia's second best team? Sikandar Raza gives 'African' answer; flips script
content: Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza deflected a reporter's question about Asian T20 team rankings, stating his focus is solely on his national team. He asserted Zimbabwe's position as the second-best team in Africa. Raza also suggested that reaching the tri-series final might be considered an upset by some.

title: 'Fatwa issued': BJP defends Tharoor for PM praise; takes 'Nazi' jab at Cong
content: BJP slammed Congress for criticising Shashi Tharoor's praise of PM Modi's speech, dubbing the party 'Indira Nazi Congress' for its 'emergency mindset' and discouraging internal dissent. While Tharoor lauded Modi's focus on development and cultural heritage, Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate found the address unimpressive and questioned Tharoor's appreciation.

title: 'China will catch us in AI race, if...': Trump's 'warning' to US
content: President Donald Trump has called for a unified federal standard for artificial intelligence regulation. He warns that a fragmented approach with state-level rules could allow China to surpass the United States in the global AI race. Trump wants lawmakers to include this measure in defense legislation or pass it as a separate bill. This push faces resistance from those who want to protect state-level AI regulations, particularly concerning child safety and copyright.

title: Pearls before swine: Trump pigs out on epithets
content: President Trump escalated tensions with the press, directing a crude insult at a female journalist and threatening to revoke a network's license. These confrontations, including calling a reporter "piggy" and a network "fake news," align with his documented pattern of using gendered slurs to deflect from tough questions and undermine female critics.

title: No neck brace for Shubman Gill! Team IND arrive in Guwahati - watch
content: India captain Shubman Gill arrived in Guwahati without his neck brace, signaling encouraging recovery from his injury sustained during the Kolkata Test. While his participation in the second Test against South Africa remains uncertain, the management will make a late decision.  The team has secured ample cover with drafted-in players and available reserves.

title: Boosting credit profile 101: Struggling with low credit score? This 2-3-4 rule will help
content: Applying for too many credit cards at once can harm your credit score. The 2-3-4 rule suggests limiting applications to two within 30 days, three in a year, and four in two years. This approach helps manage spending, avoid fees, and build a stronger credit profile over time.

title: Can an AI run Google: CEO Sundar Pichai answers
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai believes artificial intelligence could eventually manage his role, calling the CEO position 'one of the easier things' for AI. He anticipates AI agents will handle more complex tasks independently within a year, acknowledging significant societal disruptions and job transformations. Pichai advises young people to embrace change, as AI will augment professions like teaching and medicine.

title: From “Doo Doo Doo” to dollars: How Baby Shark made $400 million
content: A South Korean startup, Pinkfong, transformed from a small digital-content company into a multi-million dollar enterprise, largely driven by the viral success of the children's song 'Baby Shark'. Despite initial humble beginnings and legal challenges, the company has expanded its offerings and aims to prove its continued relevance beyond its biggest hit.

title: Orry summoned in drugs case: Mumbai police serve notice for questioning; ANC to probe
content: The Mumbai Police has summoned social media personality Orhan “Orry” Awatramani in connection with the Rs 252-crore mephedrone case, ANI reported. Officials said Orry has been directed to appear before the Anti-Narcotics Cell’s (ANC) Ghatkopar unit at 10 am on Thursday for questioning.

title: Ashes: Ahead of 'biggest series', Ben Stokes tells England not to be 'afraid'
content: Stokes urged England to approach the contest with clarity after selectors kept their options open by naming off-spinner Shoaib Bashir in a 12-man squad for the first Test. In September, England head coach Brendon McCullum had said this Ashes was "the biggest series of all our lives". Stokes agreed, telling Sky Sports, "we’d be lying to ourselves" to say otherwise.

title: Tech firm whose founder beat Musk as world's richest for a day loses 30% market value
content: Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk in wealth after Oracle's stock surged on a massive OpenAI cloud deal. However, Oracle's value has since plummeted, erasing those gains and pushing Ellison down the rankings. Musk has since reclaimed his top spot, driven by strong performance in Tesla and SpaceX.

title: 'Will be risky': Hardik, Bumrah to miss ODIs against South Africa
content: All-rounder Hardik Pandya is unlikely to feature in the upcoming ODI series against South Africa as he focuses on recovering from a quadriceps injury ahead of the T20 World Cup. Jasprit Bumrah is also expected to be rested from the ODI matches due to workload management, with the focus shifting to T20Is until the next IPL.

title: Gisele Bündchen says focusing on Tom Brady’s career took personal toll
content: Shannon Sharpe's podcast comments resurfaced, suggesting emotional fulfillment, not wealth, may have driven Gisele Bündchen's divorce from Tom Brady. Sharpe theorized that despite Brady's fortune, unmet needs for time and attention could have eroded their 13-year marriage. This perspective continues to resonate, highlighting that financial security alone cannot sustain relationships under pressure.

title: Joe Burrow latest injury update: NFL Insider reveals Cincinnati Bengals quarterback may return by Thanksgiving to face the Ravens
content: Joe Burrow's recovery from a serious turf toe injury is astonishingly ahead of schedule. NFL Insider Jay Glazer reports Burrow is progressing rapidly, potentially returning two months earlier than initially projected. This remarkable comeback is a massive boost for the Bengals, whose win-loss record significantly improves with Burrow under center.

title: Video sparks allegations of Trevon Diggs’ role in violent elevator encounter
content: Surveillance footage has surfaced regarding an elevator altercation in Los Angeles, allegedly involving individuals connected to the Diggs family. While Trevon Diggs isn't officially charged, a civil suit names him, and his brother Darez has faced legal action. The victim claims robbery and assault, sparking intense scrutiny.

title: 'Safe' trap: How 19 women were drawn into extremism by Dr Shaheen; all untraceable
content: Authorities are actively searching for 19 women from Kanpur and surrounding areas who were reportedly influenced by arrested Jaish-e-Mohammed operative Dr. Shaheen Shahid. Investigators believe these women were radicalized through her manipulative speeches and outreach network.  Efforts are underway to locate them using various tracking methods to understand Dr. Shaheen's full operation.

title: Instagram CEO: 2 qualities that drive top AI talent beyond Ivy League
content: AI talent is in high demand. Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri highlights scrappiness and rapid learning as key traits for top AI engineers.  Traditional degrees are less important than hands-on experience.  This shift offers new opportunities for aspiring professionals in the evolving AI field.  Competition for these skilled individuals is intense.

title: 'Out only in gully cricket': Ashwin on bizarre Ranji dismissal for hitting ball twice
content: A rare 'hit the ball twice' dismissal occurred in the Ranji Trophy, with Manipur's Lamabam Ajay Singh given out for deliberately using his bat to stop the ball from hitting the stumps. This unusual mode of dismissal, governed by MCC Law 34, hasn't been seen in the Ranji Trophy since 2005. R Ashwin reacted sharply to the same on X.

title: 'Things to come': Mahua posts old photo of B'desh arresting ex-poll chief; BJP reacts
content: TMC leader Mahua Moitra sparked controversy by comparing India's election process to Bangladesh's, drawing sharp criticism from the BJP. Meanwhile, Rahul Gandhi and other Congress leaders voiced concerns over the Election Commission's voter roll revision exercise, alleging it could disenfranchise legitimate voters and calling it a "sinister attempt to destroy Democracy."

title: The house of Lalu: Inside the slow, painful unraveling of Bihar’s most powerful political dynasty
content: Bihar's 2025 election results have triggered a significant crisis within the Rashtriya Janata Dal, leading to a dramatic drop in seats and exposing deep-seated family and organizational rifts.  The fallout includes public declarations of departure and accusations of gatekeeping, casting a shadow over the party's future stability and leadership.

title: Explainer: What to check before buying an air purifier; key features, common myths busted
content: Air quality impacts health, making air purifiers a household necessity. This guide explains how they work, the filters used, and key buying factors like CADR ratings. It debunks common myths and offers maintenance tips. Understanding costs and exploring alternative tech solutions like face masks are also covered. Proper selection and usage ensure cleaner indoor air for everyone.

title: From processed snacks to salt: 5 foods your kidneys hate, and why
content: The consumption of processed foods, which includes packaged snacks, deli meats and ready-to-eat meals, leads to kidney damage, because these products contain artificial ingredients, and unhealthy fats and excessive salt. Research indicates that consuming ultra-processed foods (UPFs) leads to kidney disease development, that accelerates kidney function deterioration

title: Cambridge picks 'parasocial' as word of the year: What it means
content: Parasocial language has quietly reshaped how today’s youth think, learn, and plan their futures. What began as one-sided admiration has evolved into emotional outsourcing, where influencers and AI systems function as mentors, motivators, and confidants. This shift alters classroom engagement, blurs career expectations, and challenges students to distinguish digital intimacy from genuine connection.

title: How Gen Z in US is reinventing college to survive a volatile job market
content: Gen Z students, facing a tightening job market and rising unemployment among recent graduates, are increasingly turning to double majors as a strategic safeguard. With universities reporting dramatic surges in dual-degree pursuits and research showing significantly reduced income shocks for double majors, students are diversifying skills to stay resilient, adaptable and competitive in an economy shaped by AI and rapid disruption.

title: 'Gogoi can fight polls in Pak': Himanta mocks Cong MP - Assam 2026 battle heats up
content: Political heat rises in Assam ahead of the 2026 assembly polls. Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi criticises the BJP's delimitation and voter revision plans. CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that Gogoi should contest elections in Pakistan after BJP sweeps the 2026 polls. The Election Commission has ordered a special revision of electoral rolls, aiming to identify ineligible voters.

title: U-19 World Cup: India to open campaign against USA on January 15; see full schedule
content: India's U-19 cricket team will kick off their 2026 World Cup campaign against the USA on January 15 in Bulawayo. The tournament, co-hosted by Zimbabwe and Namibia, features 16 teams across four groups. India is placed in Group A alongside the USA, Bangladesh, and New Zealand. India and Pakistan are not placed in the same group.

title: Not Sachin, Kohli, or Dravid - Shai Hope becomes 1st batter to achieve this rare feat
content: Shai Hope's brilliant unbeaten 109 in a rain-shortened ODI against New Zealand wasn't enough as the hosts secured a five-wicket victory. Hope's century, his first against New Zealand, saw him equal Brian Lara's 19 ODI hundreds and become the first to score centuries against all Test-playing nations. He also surpassed 6,000 ODI runs.

title: Delhi car blast probe: Al-Falah University ‘raked in’ Rs 415cr from fees; new details emerge
content: Enforcement Directorate arrested Al-Falah group chairman Jawad Siddiqui.  Crores were allegedly siphoned off to family-linked companies.  Contracts for construction and catering were awarded to businesses owned by his wife and children.  The arrest follows a probe into financial irregularities and fraudulent practices.  The agency seized cash and digital devices during searches.

title: Bhopal: Over a dozen masked men vandalize cafe with no intention to loot; probe on
content: Masked assailants stormed a Bhopal café, vandalizing furniture with swords and sticks in a swift, violent attack. CCTV footage of the incident has gone viral. Police are investigating the incident, suspecting personal enmity as the motive behind the unprovoked destruction.

title: PSL in trouble! Team owner who tore up notice, now threatens legal action on league
content: Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen publicly claims the franchise is being excluded from the PSL's valuation and renewal process, citing a lack of response from league management. Tareen stated that despite multiple attempts through formal and legal channels, the team has received no communication, prompting a warning of potential legal action if the impasse continues.

title: ‘Subject close to heart’: PM Modi hails farming sector reforms
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi envisioned India as a global natural farming hub, highlighting a significant transformation in the agriculture sector over the past decade. He noted agricultural exports have nearly doubled, with youth increasingly embracing farming as a modern career.  The PM lauded Tamil Nadu farmers for their courage and innovation at a recent summit.

title: Jaishankar opens two new consulates in Russia; hails Delhi-Moscow ties
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Wednesday inaugurated two new Consulates General in Russia, Yekaterinburg and Kazan. This move marks a significant step in deepening India and Russia bilateral ties. The new missions will foster economic, technological, and scientific cooperation. They will also support the large Indian community residing in Russia.

title: Kolkata: Woman receives bullet injury in Howrah housing complex; husband detained
content: A woman was injured by a bullet grazed her neck inside a residential complex in Howrah's Shibpur area. Her husband claims the incident was accidental while cleaning his licensed firearm. Police are investigating the husband's statement and the circumstances of the firing.

title: Verdict in absentia, empathy in short supply: Reading B'desh through its Hasina coverage
content: Bangladeshi media largely avoids sharp criticism following Sheikh Hasina's death sentence, instead adopting a matter-of-fact tone. Coverage reveals little empathy for Hasina, with minimal interrogation of her claims of a rigged tribunal. The nation's newspapers are discussing her downfall as a settled matter, shifting focus to the political vacuum she leaves behind.

title: ED attaches 9 luxury Dubai properties worth Rs 51.7 cr; linked to bank fraud
content: The Enforcement Directorate has seized nine luxury properties in Dubai valued at over Rs 51 crore. These assets are linked to a massive Rs 1,266 crore fraud against the State Bank of India. The fraud allegedly involves Advantage Overseas Private Limited and its owner Shrikant Bhasi. Funds were siphoned off through shell companies and used to acquire these foreign assets.

title: 28 people died since SIR began: Mamata; Bengal CM claims 'inhuman' pressure on workers
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee expressed deep concern over the death of a Booth Level Officer in Jalpaiguri, attributing it to "unbearable pressure" from the ongoing Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls.

title: 'Venomous rhetoric': Citizens pen letter against Rahul; accuse Cong of making unsubstantiated claims
content: A group of 272 eminent citizens, including retired judges, bureaucrats, and military officers, have penned an open letter criticizing Rahul Gandhi and the Congress for allegedly undermining constitutional bodies, particularly the Election Commission. The letter accuses the opposition of baseless rhetoric and "systematic and conspiratorial attacks" against the ECI, urging civil society to support the institution.

title: Let's talk about North Texas -- why the Mean Green is the bet to make in December
content: north Texas is sitting -115 both ways to make or miss the playoff . the committee is reacting to resumes, but not quality wins . UNT has one loss, a 63-36 defensive collapse to south Florida .

title: Anthony Yarde hoping third time's a charm in David Benavidez world title showdown
content: Anthony Yarde was stopped by artur Beterbiev and Sergey Kovalev in 2023 and 2019 respectively . the 34-year-old says he will be better in his third attempt at winning a world light heavyweight title on sunday . he was stopped in eight rounds for three versions of the world title, after lasting 11 rounds .

title: MMA P4P rankings: Shevchenko, Makhachev new No. 1s -- but just one unanimous
content: Valentina Shevchenko was no. 2 on the ESPN men's pound-for-pound rankings . the pair ascended to no. 1 after dominant victories at UFC 322 . Makhachev's opponent, Jack Della Maddalena, was ranked eighth among men .

title: Best stories, wildest celebrations from amazing round of qualifiers
content: the November international break delivered more than its fair share of thrills and spills as more national teams secured their place at the 2026 finals . the break produced a plethora of qualifying drama as tiny nations reached the finals for the first time, last-minute goals decided matches and a handful of major names tumbled by the wayside .

title: Alabama and JMU have something in common: anger about the CFP rankings
content: the ACC and the group of 5 will supply champions, too, whether the Big Ten likes it or not . the winner of a week 13 showdown between USC and Oregon should be on track for a bid . it's hard to imagine that Notre Dame is left out, given its no. 9 ranking .

title: What we're hearing on the WNBA's CBA negotiations
content: the WNBA and WNBPA agreed on a 30-day extension of the current CBA . the league's latest proposal includes revenue sharing with a maximum salary of $1.1 million starting in 2026 . it remains unclear what the players think of this proposal and whether it moves the needle ahead of the new Nov. 30 deadline .

title: Texas firmly out, Miami in limbo and the G5’s flavor of the week
content: the new rankings keep Ohio State at the top of the pile, while Texas Tech slides into the no. 5 spot in Week 13 . Notre Dame should buy some furniture and move in . the team's only win against a CFP-ranked team is against no. 15 USC .

title: Panthers, Rangers reveal Winter Classic jerseys
content: the 17th NHL Winter Classic is scheduled for Jan. 2 at LoanDepot Park . it's the southernmost outdoor game ever played in the NHL . the Panthers' winter Classic jersey references the team's original "leaping panther" logo .

title: Logan Paul drops litigation over MJ-signed court
content: the move comes as the initially granted and extended temporary restraining order expired . he initially won the signed floor piece at auction for $562,555.42 . the floor was advertised by Heritage as "the ultimate Michael Jordan display piece"

title: 🎇 Fireworks for a field goal? Only in the Bottom 10

title: Saints releasing veteran WR Cooks, source says
content: new: source confirms he will become a free agent if he goes unclaimed on waivers . new: he has 729 receptions for 9,697 yards and 60 touchdowns in 12 seasons . cooks signed a two-year deal worth up to $13 million to return to the team in march .

title: Baba Siddique case: NIA gets 11-day custody of Anmol Bishnoi
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics.
